subject: Build a GUI
description:
As a user I want a GUI to be implemented so that it looks and feels good while using the tool

**Acceptance criteria:**

*   Should be able to pass the commands from the GUI
*   Implement user friendly layouts

**Definition of done:**

*   Able to show feature in the product demo
*   passes tests according to the acceptance criteria

subject: Getting list of committers
description:
As a user, I want to get the list of committers when using guet in alphabetical order so that the list of committers is organized and makes it easier to search for information.

Acceptance criteria:

*   Is able to get the alphabetically ordered list of active committers
*   Does the authorization of the members for the list

Definition of Done:

*   Able to show feature in the product demo
*   passes tests according to the acceptance criteria

subject: Persistent preferences

As a user I want preferences to be persistent so that I can don't have to add them each time

Acceptance criteria:

Make window persistent and resizable
Add 'User Settings' feature

subject: Log output for `add` and `remove` commands
description:
As a user, I want to see the output log when I give `add` and `remove` commands so that I am aware of changes made through the command.

Acceptance criteria:
Display the output log after the command is given.

Definition of Done:
Should be able to show the feature in the product demo.
Passes tests according to the acceptance criteria.

subject: `add` or `remove` multiple users
description:
As a user, I want the library to support adding or removing multiple committers at a time so that I don't have to repeat the commands multiple times.

Acceptance criteria:
Must be able to add or remove multiple committers using a single command.

Definition of Done:
Able to show the feature in the product demo.
Passes all tests according to acceptance criteria.

subject: Indicate Pairing strategy
description:
As a user, I want to be able to indicate pairing strategy so that I can know the roles of the members working on the same user story.

Acceptance criteria :
must be able to show the user the members working as a pair on the same user-story

Definition of done-
Should pass all the tests according to the acceptance criteria
Display the functionality in the working software

subject: Get issues from Git-Hub
description:
As a user, I should be able to get all open issues from Git-hub so that I am aware of the status of the issues.

Acceptance criteria:
should be able to display issues

Definition of done:
passes all tests in accordance with the acceptance criteria
able to show the feature in product demo

subject: Set co-author in Taiga
description: As a user, I want to be able to add a co-author in a comment that I currently am working with in the taiga task.

subject: Addressing Technical Debt
description:
As a developer, I want to ensure the technical debt incurred so far is paid off so that it doesn't spiral out of control in the future.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Ensure the code base is clean and free from any technical debt

Definition of Done:
- Address variable naming conventions
- Addressing unused code blocks
- Optimising logic where ever possible
- Addressing bad spacings and indentations

subject: Track Peer Programming Productivity
description:
As a user, I want to be able to track which pair contributes the most amount of work to the development of the product so that we can make strategic decisions for the future.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Display the best performing pair.

Definition of done:
- To be able to show the feature in the product demo.
